definition: The group of people with the authority to govern a country or state.
Existing, occurring, or carried on between nations.
The aggregate of people living together in a more or less ordered community.
All existing matter and space considered as a whole.
The wealth and resources of a country or region, especially in terms of production and consumption.
The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.
The faculty or action of forming new ideas or images not present to the senses.
A forcible overthrow of a government or social order in favor of a new system.
The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources.
Customs or beliefs passed down from generation to generation.
Consisting of many different and connected parts; not simple.
Far on or ahead in development or progress.
Rights believed to belong justifiably to every person.
The ideas, customs, and social behavior of a particular people or society.
The ability to be maintained at a certain rate or level, especially without harming the environment.
The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes.
A new method, idea, product, etc.
The study of past events.
The surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.
The process of receiving or giving systematic instruction.
The imparting or exchanging of information or news.
A system of rules that a particular country or community recognizes as regulating the actions of its members.
A result or effect of an action or condition.
A set of ideas intended to explain something, especially one based on general principles independent of the thing to be explained.
A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by an organization or individual.
A written or spoken agreement that is intended to be enforceable by law.
The action or process of investing money for profit or material result.
Discussion aimed at reaching an agreement.
A scientific procedure undertaken to test a hypothesis.
A thing done successfully, typically by effort, courage, or skill.
The profession, activity, or skill of managing international relations.
The action of leading a group of people or an organization.
The expression of disapproval of someone or something based on perceived faults or mistakes.
The simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems.
The use of largely automatic equipment in a system of operation or production.
Forward or onward movement toward a destination, especially a better state.
Data that is processed or organized in a meaningful way to be useful for decision-making.
The desire to promote the welfare of others, typically through the donation of money, resources, or time.
A detailed analysis and assessment of something, especially a literary, philosophical, or political theory.
A formal discussion on a particular topic, in which opposing arguments are put forward.
